oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Late-Stage beta-Epimerization. A Stereodivergent to Stereoconvergent Relay to the First Total Synthesis of (+)-Murolic Acid
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: FERNANDES, RA
PATIL, PH
CHOWDHURY, AK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Total synthesis
Natural products
Asymmetric synthesis
Rearrangement
Epimerization
CLAISEN REARRANGEMENT
ASYMMETRIC DIHYDROXYLATION
GAMMA-BUTYROLACTONES

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The first total synthesis of (+)-murolic acid is accomplished in 17 steps from ester 9 in 14.8% overall yield. The key steps involve asymmetric dihydroxylation, orthoester Johnson-Claisen rearrangement and -methylenation using Stiles reagent. A beneficial late stage -epimerization reverted a stereodivergent relay to a stereoconvergent completion of an efficient synthesis of (+)-murolic acid.
